title: card.led Request Application Programming Interface (API) Schema
description:
Used along with the [card.aux API](/api-reference/notecard-api/card-requests/latest#card-aux) to turn connected LEDs on/off or to manage a single connected NeoPixel.

If using monochromatic LEDs, they must be wired according to the instructions provided in the guide on [Using Monitor Mode](/notecard/notecard-walkthrough/working-with-the-notecard-aux-pins#using-monitor-mode). Please note that the use of monochromatic LEDs is not supported by Notecard for LoRa.

If using NeoPixels, the NeoPixel (or strip of NeoPixels) must be wired according to the instructions provided in the guide on [Using Neo-Monitor Mode](/notecard/notecard-walkthrough/working-with-the-notecard-aux-pins#using-neo-monitor-mode).

mode.description:
Used to specify the color of the LED to turn on or off.

**Note:** Notecard LoRa does not support monochromatic **LED** modes, only **NeoPixels**.

off.description: Set to `true` to turn the specified LED or NeoPixel off.

on.description: Set to `true` to turn the specified LED or NeoPixel on.

annotations.title: note
annotations.description: The Notecard must first be configured for the appropriate LED type using `card.aux`. For monochromatic LEDs, use `{"req": "card.aux", "mode": "led"}`. For NeoPixels, use `{"req": "card.aux", "mode": "neo"}`.

samples.title: Turn Red LED On
samples.description: As shown above, the Notecard must also be in `led` mode and the LED(s) wired according to the instructions provided in the guide on [Using Monitor Mode](/notecard/notecard-walkthrough/working-with-the-notecard-aux-pins#using-monitor-mode).

samples.title: Turn Blue NeoPixel On
samples.description: As shown above, the Notecard must also be in `neo`, `neo-monitor`, or `track-neo-monitor` mode and the NeoPixel(s) wired according to the instructions provided in the guide on [Using Neo-Monitor Mode](/notecard/notecard-walkthrough/working-with-the-notecard-aux-pins#using-neo-monitor-mode).
